title: Champions That Need a VU (at least to their base skin/vfx), But Not Necessarily a VGU

replies.body: Add {{champion:51}} and {{champion:21}}
Was looking for someone mentioning Caitlyn, she has to get her visuals updated to finally fit in the aesthetic of Piltover.

She's wearing a typical steampunk outfit.  Add a corset and a jacket and she'd fit in just as well as Jayce.

Maybe shorten the skirt and make the jacket go down to the skirt's former length.

The outfit she is wearing definitely isn't appropriate her position as the sheriff of Piltover, tho.
Hell, Riot acknowledged that ages ago and even made Camille have quotes mocking her for it.

Caitlyn looks like she is wearing a slutty steampunk cosplay more than she looks like a representive of Piltover, that's definitely a problem.

Well the main complaint about her is the skirt.  Except you'd be hard pressed to find a steam punk girl not in either a skirt or girly short shorts.

Like.  Really hard pressed. 

Keep in mind that, as she is a fantasy character in a fantasy world with a fantasy culture, and beyond that is a sniper, she really shouldn't be dressed for 'battle'.  She doesn't give chase, if you run you're getting shot.


You can't call for a longer skirt because that would inhibit her movement.  

At best you can either, take the hat away(not happening, she's hat lady), or give her a jacket.

She is a fantasy character in a fantasy world with a fantasy culture, agreed.

However, her outfit _doesn't fit her fantasy culture anymore_.
Piltover has changed over the years, the aesthetics of it are majorly different from the time Caitlyn got created.

I agree that she has to keep wearing a top hat, it is iconic and has to stay. But the rest of her clothing can and should change alot.
There are quite some visual update concepts for her on the internet, which would be a great improvement:
http://i.imgur.com/WXqFoEH.png https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/005/957/855/large/thomas-randby-cait-1.jpg?1494988560
These are some examples which would make her look way better, considering the position she has in Piltover.

Her current outfit is pretty much the cliche steampunk girl and yes, these usually have either a skirt or girly short shorts, like you said.
But Piltover isn't this "cliche steampunk" environment anymore. It has evolved, RIot made it its own thing with the hextech designs and Piltover has a very unique design now. Caitlyn should reflect that and not be a steampunk girl like you find all over the place on the internet, she should show the unique design of Piltover.

Ugh please no. That VU was designed by IronStylus who was allergic to females showing slightest skin. That outfit does not make her look like sheriff either. If anything it makes her look like some circus hostess.
MF is fine, she got a model update, she just needs a new voice over right now to match her new personality

Her personality is to act sexy in front of her enemies to throw them off guard.  Her VO fits this, what they really need to do is get rid of the 4th wall breaking lines and add a few more 'ruthless' lines for when attacking.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2019-04-07T05:21:33.680+0000)
>
> Her personality is to act sexy in front of her enemies to throw them off guard.  Her VO fits this, what they really need to do is get rid of the 4th wall breaking lines and add a few more 'ruthless' lines for when attacking.

What kind of man falls for this? If I see n angry pirate lady with giant pistols, im running away in terror.

[Distracted by the sexy](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DistractedByTheSexy) is a valid tactic.  As is [obfuscating stupidity](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObfuscatingStupidity).

Women in history and myth have used both to fuck over men, sometimes to hilarious effect.

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=00010001000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-12T18:53:09.909+0000)
>
> [Distracted by the sexy](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DistractedByTheSexy) is a valid tactic.  As is [obfuscating stupidity](https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObfuscatingStupidity).
> 
> Women in history and myth have used both to fuck over men, sometimes to hilarious effect.

I can understand feigning stupidity, but what kind of bozo allows a woman's appearance to mess them up? I see pretty woman all the time yet im not tripping over myself or becoming unwound. lol so funny.

Some Kunoichi fought topless for a reason. XD

Even just giving the guy a boner can throw off his coordination.
(Also, most guys would be thrown off by a girl they find attractive.)

> [{quoted}](name=Terozu,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=0001000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-12T19:53:22.189+0000)
>
> Some Kunoichi fought topless for a reason. XD
> 
> Even just giving the guy a boner can throw off his coordination.
> (Also, most guys would be thrown off by a girl they find attractive.)

this is true as when i really like a girl it messes up my focus. so you are right. also fighting topless seems dangerous.
It was considered dishonorable to kill a woman in battle for whatever reason, so it was also a safety net, ironically.
Hold on, I thought Rammus had a visual update recently? He does look shinier than his inception nowadays.

> [{quoted}](name=KnivingDude,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-04-05T18:41:03.680+0000)
>
> Hold on, I thought Rammus had a visual update recently? He does look shinier than his inception nowadays.

HAHAHAHA, no. This needs a VGU. He may have gotten a texture pass at some point a few years back, but he's in dire need of visual and gameplay modernization.
https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/d/dd/Rammus_Render.png/revision/latest?cb=20190112190938

Ashe, Tryndamere, Master Yi, Twisted Fate, and Katarina were VU'd in 2012. Ashe and Katarina have since received kit updates. They are not even remotely close to needing VU work anytime soon. Tryndamere, though, DESPERATELY needs that canker sore of a kit replaced with something less cancerous.

Elise doesn't need a VU. Corki is HELLA BAD and needs a VGU, his kit is god awful and awkward as hell. Malzahar, Rammus, and Shaco all need full VGUs, because their kits are antiquated and lacking in modernization.

The rest I'll give you. They could use VUs.
Master Yi was actually 2013 but yeah.
{{champion:42}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:35}} are full VGU candidates
Ashe, Yi, Kat, TF and Xin have been visually updated. Malz looks decent. Trynd could use one. Corki, Vlad and Shaco need full vgus. For sure.
Xin has actually never had visual updates. He has gotten several gameplay updates but not visual.
... Didn't he just get a little visual upgrade?

No. His visuals have not been touched, all that visually changed were some of his effects and splash art.

As seen here in the update list he has only ever had gameplay changes
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202294884-Champion-Update-Schedule

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=0015000100000000,timestamp=2019-04-11T18:31:50.830+0000)
>
> No. His visuals have not been touched, all that visually changed were some of his effects and splash art.
> 
> As seen here in the update list he has only ever had gameplay changes
> https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202294884-Champion-Update-Schedule

No they got his texture and gave him new animations.

Still not a visual update. They just did tweaks and/or new to animations, Visual updates involve being given a new model and rigging to all skins.

So he is visually the same since release.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=001500010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-12T10:13:08.585+0000)
>
> Still not a visual update. They just did tweaks and/or new to animations, Visual updates involve being given a new model and rigging to all skins.
> 
> So he is visually the same since release.

True indeed. Do you think he needs a full vgu?

Just because Champions have received visual updates in the past doesn't mean they don't need another one. Ashe's visuals and VO no longer fit the character she's supposed to be now, and Yi looks very mismatched and needs a cleaner design to help fit him into his concept and the world he lives in. I'm fine with them not needing one at the moment, but eventually they're going to need at least a Ezreal or even Morgana level VU

Everyone will eventually need that, even brand new champs. They have to draw the line somewhere. A large group of these have already gotten them and are still decent compared to newer releases, so they really need to focus on those who have never received any kind of visual change.

Not really, unless Riot does another massive lore retcon and changes way too many things. Like, if the lore remains consistent, then well-done Champion like Pyke and Zoe won't need one down the line. 

Because of the great lore retcon, and how the core concepts of Runeterra and its nations have shifted massively, a large majority of the Champions ARE outdated to some extent.

I definitely think Champions like Corki, Udyr, Volibear, and Zilean need it more than other Champions. But saying that "they all need one eventually" isn't really correct. And I don't think it's bad pointing out that while some Champions aren't in horrible shape like the ones I mentioned earlier, they still could just some patching up like Ezreal.

Lore is not what controls when or why a champion needs an update. Time is the major factor in most cases. Various modeling, animation, ext techniques have improved as time goes by and they can improve the way champions look and feel. Plus, another factor is "has the kit held up". So

Champions like Pyke and Zoe don't now, but who says 10 years down the line they won't appear to be dated? Champions like Corki, Udyr, ect havent had any kind of Visual change since they were released. They have had some smaller gameplay but still the major thing that brings them to the front of the line is those visuals are over 10 years old and just do not fit the current art style.

Ah, I see what you were referring to. I was solely referring to visual updates, not gameplay ones. And lore plays a huge role in how a Champion would look/what their personality would be like or show in-game. 

I can see Champions like Pyke or Zoe getting gameplay updates to meet a new standard or maybe some smoother animations, but I also don't expect them to need a giant design overhaul like other Champions need, since they fit their current concepts quite well. Kind of like LeBlanc's/Talon's sole gameplay updates with no visual design changes.

The only time they would need to change visually is if their concept changes drastically, or if the lore moves forward and that causes it to change.

But I understand what you're saying.

Do you really? cause I don't think you do.

Like take Ezreal for example.

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-KhiKDkVXZ6A/VFn9IfSr3KI/AAAAAAAAce4/d9o6zMIdCzs/s1600/ez1.jpg
This is his original look

https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ij9KwafeD0k/W6qcQnFV-rI/AAAAAAABH44/uoJfTCTDYFcc4Yn586xLTBYV98CnCFd5ACLcBGAs/s1600/ez.jpg
This is his current look

Time is what still what brings forth the reasoning to update the champions.  When you look at how Ezreal used to look, you can see he's badly proportioned vs how he is now which is a lot smoother and more natural.

Then there were champions like Aatrox for another example, released in 2013 and then updated more recently. 
http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-zilfPeApi10/UbkIHdXxY1I/AAAAAAAAEw0/YaaoCsF92Kg/s1600/aA1.png
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5466sW8R58I/WyBfSXSV6cI/AAAAAAABBOo/K9mWAXw9QSsdmB6PqVWcL7NXNfM9Kjj8QCLcBGAs/s640/aatrox.jpg

So there are champions over time that are newer that end up needing work done to them visually.  And for him it was just within 5 years, where it started off as a Gameplay Update but also added in a Visual change as well. So a lot can change in a short time for any champion.
anyone here know what {{champion:77}} is?

> [{quoted}](name=radetari,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2019-04-05T21:13:21.325+0000)
>
> anyone here know what {{champion:77}} is?

He's listed as a champion that will get a VGU. They said in the past that they put it off due to Spirit Guard Udyr, but they said now the level of outdatedness of Udyr is outweighing the effort required to rework Spirit Guard Udyr.
Not ringing a bell

They did in fact, use to make purely visual updates. I don't exactly remember the reasoning they gave to why they swapped over to full VGUs since it was so long ago (prob back in like Season 4-5 when they stopped it). I don't think it was for monetary reasons as someone stated (although that's probably something Riot wouldn't admit to if that were the case). I am happy they are going back to it with the recent Ezreal and Morgana update though.


As for champions I do think need VUs. I do understand that some of the champions I list have had some visual work in the past, but with the way the lore has evolved since those times, I don't think their "theme" holds up as well as before. Also I won't put any champions that are already listed for a rework.

{{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:59}} 

Not exactly an exhaustive list, I just put what crossed my mind.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienMV,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2019-04-05T19:47:50.510+0000)
>
> They did in fact, use to make purely visual updates. I don't exactly remember the reasoning they gave to why they swapped over to full VGUs since it was so long ago (prob back in like Season 4-5 when they stopped it). I don't think it was for monetary reasons as someone stated (although that's probably something Riot wouldn't admit to if that were the case). I am happy they are going back to it with the recent Ezreal and Morgana update though.
> 
> 
> As for champions I do think need VUs. I do understand that some of the champions I list have had some visual work in the past, but with the way the lore has evolved since those times, I don't think their "theme" holds up as well as before. Also I won't put any champions that are already listed for a rework.
> 
> {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:59}} 
> 
> Not exactly an exhaustive list, I just put what crossed my mind.

Ashe had a VU in 2012. She could use a texture update, which I think will fix many of her visual inconsistencies, but not a VU. I'm on the fence about Jax. I personally believe he's way too stat checky to remain as he is, but I guess that would be fixed with a minor GU like Ezreal got with his VU.

No, a texture update won't fix all the problems with Ashe. Her VO is vastly outdated as well and no longer fits the character she's supposed to be, along with all of her animations with things like jokes/taunts. She isn't in dire need of an update compared to other Champions, and I'm willing to wait for any amount of years, but if Ashe is going to be updated, it needs to be a VU-level update.

> [{quoted}](name=AnotherPurple379,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=000900000001,timestamp=2019-04-11T05:19:10.839+0000)
>
> No, a texture update won't fix all the problems with Ashe. Her VO is vastly outdated as well and no longer fits the character she's supposed to be, along with all of her animations with things like jokes/taunts. She isn't in dire need of an update compared to other Champions, and I'm willing to wait for any amount of years, but if Ashe is going to be updated, it needs to be a VU-level update.

A texture pass would fix a great deal of her problems, and now that you mention it, a VO pass. Otherwise, her animations aren't in a bad place.

Eh, I guess stuff like her running and attack animations don't need too many changes. I was more referring to her joke/taunt/ide animations. I think it could be something more creative/more in character for her.

I'm still debating whether texture updates will be enough or if she needs something more than that. But yeah, at the VERY least she needs a new VO and visual design.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2019-04-05T21:11:02.818+0000)

I personally believe he's way too stat checky to remain as he is, but I guess that would be fixed with a minor GU like Ezreal got with his VU.

When you say a texture update, do you mean something like this?

http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/3a66eed6aac4bcd610944d210d5bf7fd.jpg

Where the shape doesn't change but the visuals look different? If it is, then yeah, that sounds reasonable.
What really made me consider a visual update for Ashe is this fan art that I really love.
https://www.artstation.com/artwork/JPYYz

To be honest, the thing I want more than visual changes are some new animations for Ashe, she just seems really stilted to me.

> [{quoted}](name=AlienMV,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=sMTNJiBq,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2019-04-05T19:47:50.510+0000)

Ashe and Nid already had a vu. The rest for sure need them.
